annotation.summary: The GM has flexibility in preparing adventures, either by creating original content, using published material, or blending both to suit their players and play style.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this section describes preparation choices rather than in-game actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires a GM role and access to either original or published adventure materials.

annotation.summary: The paragraph explains that Starfinder gameplay is divided into three modes—exploration, encounter, and downtime—each representing different pacing and activities within the story. Players shift between these modes as the narrative demands, with each mode offering a distinct play style and structure.
annotation.action_economy: Not directly applicable; each mode has its own pacing and rules for actions.
annotation.prerequisites: None; applies to all players and characters during gameplay.

annotation.summary: Obozaya uses an auto-fire attack that affects all creatures in a 20-foot cone. Allies are protected due to bombard fighting style training. Instead of an attack roll, targets make Reflex saves to determine damage taken. One enemy succeeds and takes half damage, while another fails and takes full damage.
annotation.action_economy: Standard action or attack action (depending on system rules for auto-fire)
